metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3890 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Heap buffer overflow in Crashpad in Google Chrome on Android prior to107.0.5304.106 allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the rendererprocess to potentially perform a sandbox escape via a crafted HTML page.(Chromium security severity: High)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3890` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 108.0.5359.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.5
chromium-browser-l10n - 108.0.5359.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.5
chromium-chromedriver - 108.0.5359.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.5
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 108.0.5359.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.5
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 108.0.5359.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '108.0.5359.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.5').
